job.title: Sr. Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: <p>As a SRE you are a bridge between development and operations by applying a software engineering mindset to infrastructure services.&nbsp;The SRE is focused on the overall reliability and availability of the enterprise cloud and must understand complex enterprise networks, their dependencies, design, and build.&nbsp;The SRE will identify and reduce manual processes and apply industry incident management, change management, and DevOps concepts.&nbsp;You will be part of a small family and have huge impact on their opportunities for growth.</p><p><br></p><p>Job Responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Maintain service stability and reliability by working with internal teams and external vendor partners</li><li>Have a complete understanding of operational tools and concepts, such as alerting, monitoring, logging, and health checks</li><li>Work with and lead other team members by staying informed of industry innovation, knowledge transfer, and develop team members</li><li>Identify opportunities for system improvement and process improvement and partner vendors</li><li>Design, plan, build, and implement monitoring tools that promote visibility, transparency, and early detection in a complex technical environment</li><li>Ability to handle multiple priorities and troubleshoot complex issues quickly and successfully</li><li>Partner with ITSM Sr. Manager on post-incident reviews by putting actions into place to prevent recurring incidents</li><li>Be a technology evangelist for the organization</li><li>Participate in on-call rotation for level 3 support escalations</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Required Qualifications:</p><ul><li>2-3 years of experience on any cloud platform</li><li>Hands on experience of writing code in C#, .net or Java, Heavy SQL, SSRS</li><li>Solid understanding and experience in data structures, algorithms, and software design</li><li>Experience with virtual VPN connectivity, network ports, and firewalls</li><li>Experience in troubleshooting relational databases and distributed platforms</li><li>Highly skilled in identifying performance bottlenecks, identifying abnormal system behavior, and resolving root cause of service issues</li><li>Experience in Incident Management and ITIL Service Operations</li><li>Must be able to work in a collaborative cross-functional team environment</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Understanding of the CI/CD lifecycle</li><li>Working knowledge of source control systems such as git</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Preferred Qualifications:</p><ul><li>AWS Certification as Cloud Practitioner, Architect Associate, Developer Associate</li><li>Experience working with globally distributed teams</li><li>Enjoys mentoring and guiding teammates</li><li>Experience working with healthcare technologies</li><li>ITIL Foundations certification</li></ul><p><br></p><p>We are looking for someone who is local to the Lynchburg, VA metro ideally and may consider remote candidates.</p>
